page.title: 01HOUSING
page.content: {Woodmancote School}square consists mainly of residential landcover. Most of the houses are long established and one or two are several centuries old and thatched.Around the school, which is 11 years old,a housing estate is largely completed. There is also a permanent caravan site with room for summer camping. The boundary between Bishop's Cleeve and Woodmancote is drawn by the disused Honeybourne railway line which was once the main G.W.R. route north. Amenities include S.John Fisher hall and the old Bishops Cleeve school building vacated when the Infant and Junior schools combined.Now the buildings are used for community functions,blood donations and the like.
